revised_title: A New Approach to Understanding Magnetical Compass Variations
tldr: The author, Mr. De la Hire, describes his experiments with a spherical loadstone and a steel ring compass. He discovered that the steel ring compass, when touched by the poles of a strong loadstone, behaves similarly to a spherical loadstone, with one point always pointing north. This new compass could potentially help in navigating the variations of the magnetic needle at sea.
